security_audit.summary: This skill consists only of a SKILL.md markdown file containing prompt-based instructions for a bug fixing workflow. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, and no external commands are present. The file describes procedures but does not execute them. All capability references are instructional examples guiding the AI to perform actions, not actual execution vectors.

content.user_title: Fix bugs end-to-end with full workflow automation
content.value_statement: Bug fixing requires multiple steps across investigation, implementation, testing, and review. This skill automates the entire process from root cause analysis to PR creation, ensuring consistent quality and comprehensive test coverage.
actual_capabilities: Automated bug investigation using log analysis and code search
Backend and frontend bug fix implementation with minimal changes
Automatic test case generation for bug reproduction
Server startup verification for fix confirmation
Architecture review integration for code quality
QA check and Pull Request creation workflow
limitations: Requires issue description and suspected files for accurate targeting
Cannot fix architectural design issues or fundamental design flaws
Manual intervention needed for environment-specific or deployment issues

use_cases.title: Automated debugging workflow
use_cases.description: Fix production bugs quickly with systematic investigation and comprehensive test coverage

use_cases.title: Bug reproduction automation
use_cases.description: Create reliable test cases that prevent bug regression in future releases

use_cases.title: Standardized fix process
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent bug fix quality across the team with automated reviews and checks

best_practices: Provide suspected files when you have hints about the problematic area to speed up investigation
Include issue numbers in bug descriptions to link fixes to tracking systems
Review the generated test cases to ensure they cover edge cases and boundary conditions
anti_patterns: Using this skill for feature development instead of bug fixes wastes workflow automation
Skipping the architecture review step may allow bugs to reach production
Modifying unrelated code during bug fixes introduces new bugs and breaks existing functionality

faq.question: What platforms does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for bug fixing workflows.

faq.question: What is the maximum bug complexity this skill can handle?
faq.answer: The skill handles single-component bugs efficiently. Multi-component bugs work best when suspected files are specified.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: The skill integrates with qa-check and review-architecture skills, which can connect to your CI/CD validation steps.

faq.question: Does this skill access or store my codebase data?
faq.answer: The skill only reads files needed for investigation. No code or data is stored externally or transmitted anywhere.

faq.question: What if the skill cannot identify the bug cause?
faq.answer: The skill will report investigation limitations and suggest providing additional information or narrowing the suspected files.

faq.question: How is this skill different from manual debugging?
faq.answer: The skill ensures consistent quality through automated testing, review checkpoints, and comprehensive documentation of the fix.
